00020 
00021 #ifndef DISTANCELIST_H
00022 #define DISTANCELIST_H
00023 
00024 #include "graph.h"
00025 
00026 #define NBOFTEMP 4
00027 
00028 // This class compute the list of vertices at a given distance for a graph G
00029 // An ordered vector of vertices is computed
00030 // One can access to the list by distance by using this ordered vector
00031 // and an other vector that gives the number of vertices
00032 // at distance of at most d from v
00033 
00034 class DistanceList {
00035         public :
00036         // constructor
00037         // tg is the graph and tdMax is the maximal distance to compute
00038         DistanceList(Graph *tg, int tdMax) {
00039                 int i;
00040                 g = tg;
00041                 dMax = tdMax;
00042                 nbV = tg->getOrder();
00043                 nbByDistance = new short[nbV];
00044                 nbByDistanceMax = new short[nbV];
00045                 tOfSizeNbV = new short *[NBOFTEMP];
00046                 for(i = 0 ; i < NBOFTEMP ; i++) {
00047                         tOfSizeNbV[i] = new short[nbV];
00048                 }
00049                 
00050                 distList = new short[nbV];
00051                 
00052                 // clear tOfSizeNbV[0] (set it to -1)
00053                 for(i = 0 ; i < nbV ; i++) {
00054                         tOfSizeNbV[0][i] = -1;
00055                 }
00056                 lastComputed = -1;
00057         }
00058         
00059         
00060         // destructor
00061         ~DistanceList(void) {
00062                 int i;
00063                 for(i = 0 ; i < NBOFTEMP ; i++) {
00064                         delete [] tOfSizeNbV[i];
00065                 }
00066                 delete [] tOfSizeNbV;
00067                 delete [] nbByDistance;
00068                 delete [] nbByDistanceMax;
00069                 delete [] distList;
00070         }
00071         
00072         // return the number of vertices at distance of at most d from v
00073         short getNbByDistanceMax(int v, int d) {return nbByDistanceMax[d];}
00074         
00075         //
00076         short getKIThVertex(int v, int k) {return distList[k];}
00077         
00078 
00079         void computeDistanceForVertex(int i) {
00080                 int j,sizeOfTheList;
00081                 // clear tOfSizeNbV[0] (set it to -1)
00082                 /*for(j = 0 ; j < nbV ; j++) {
00083                         tOfSizeNbV[0][j] = -1;
00084                 }*/
00085                 if(lastComputed == i) return;
00086                 lastComputed = i;
00087                 tOfSizeNbV[0][i] = i;
00088                 sizeOfTheList = 0;
00089                 // add the vertex itself to the set of vertices to explore
00090                 tOfSizeNbV[2][0] = i;
00091                 // run
00092                 run(i,0,sizeOfTheList,1);
00093                 
00094                 // recopy the result
00095                 //distList[i] = new short[sizeOfTheList];
00096                 for(j = 0 ; j < sizeOfTheList ; j++) {
00097                         distList[j] = tOfSizeNbV[1][j];
00098                 }
00099                 
00100                 for(j = 1 ; j <= dMax ; j++) {
00101                                 nbByDistanceMax[j] = nbByDistanceMax[j-1] + nbByDistance[j];
00102                 }
00103                 
00104         }
00105         protected :
00106 
00107 
00108 void run(int v, int currentD, int & sizeOfTheList, int nbToExplore) {
00109         // v : the vertex to compute the distances
00110         // currentD : the Distance to explore
00111         // sizeOfTheList : current number of vertices into the ordered list
00112         // nbToExplore : nb vertices to explore into the queue tOfSizeNbV[2]
00113         int i,j;
00114         int u,w;
00115         int deg;
00116         int nbToExploreNext = 0;
00117         short * temp;
00118         
00119         // add the vertices to explore into the ordered list
00120         nbByDistance[currentD] = nbToExplore;
00121         for(i = 0 ; i < nbToExplore ; i++) {
00122                 tOfSizeNbV[1][sizeOfTheList] = tOfSizeNbV[2][i];
00123                 sizeOfTheList++;
00124         }
00125         // if the distance max is not reached           
00126         if(currentD < dMax) {
00127                 // for each vertex to explore
00128                 for(i = 0 ; i < nbToExplore ; i++) {
00129                         u = tOfSizeNbV[2][i];
00130                         deg = g->getDegree(u);
00131                         // for each successor of the vertex
00132                         for(j = 0 ; j < deg ; j++) {
00133                                 w = g->getIThSucc(u,j);
00134                                 // if the vertex has been never reached
00135                                 if(tOfSizeNbV[0][w] != v) {
00136                                         tOfSizeNbV[3][nbToExploreNext] = w;
00137                                         nbToExploreNext++;
00138                                         tOfSizeNbV[0][w] = v;
00139                                 }
00140                         }
00141                 }
00142                 // we switch the vertex soon explored with the ones to explore
00143                 temp = tOfSizeNbV[3];
00144                 tOfSizeNbV[3] = tOfSizeNbV[2];
00145                 tOfSizeNbV[2] = temp;
00146                 // recursion
00147                 run(v,currentD+1,sizeOfTheList,nbToExploreNext);
00148         }
00149         
00150         return;
00151 }
00152 
00153 Graph * g; // the graph
00154 int dMax; // maximal distance
00155 int nbV;
00156 
00157 short * nbByDistance; 
00158 // nbByDistance[v][d] = number of vertices at distance equal to d from v
00159 
00160 short * nbByDistanceMax; 
00161 // nbByDistanceMax[v][d] = number of vertices at distance equal or less to d
00162 // from v
00163 
00164 short * distList; 
00165 // disList[v] : list (short*) of vertices ordered by their distance from v
00166 
00167 // temporay
00168 short ** tOfSizeNbV;
00169 
00170 int lastComputed;
00171 };
00172 
00173 #endif
